title: Hangs on install

labels.name: triage
labels.description: The issue needs to be prioritized

body:
Spack install (any package) step hangs on my remote machine, I cannot even terminate it with SIGINT. Since I know the disk is slow, I let it work for a lot of time, but now I suspect it's hung forever. Any suggestion on how to further debug this?

### Steps to reproduce the issue

```console
$ git clone https://github.com/spack/spack.git
$ cd spack/bin
$ ./spack -d --verbose install zlib
==> [2021-01-14-13:34:56.000371] Imported install from built-in commands
==> [2021-01-14-13:34:56.002932] Reading config file /mnt/e15/ge28fok/spack/etc/spack/defaults/config.yaml
==> [2021-01-14-13:34:56.026833] Imported install from built-in commands
==> [2021-01-14-13:34:56.028281] Reading config file /mnt/e15/ge28fok/spack/etc/spack/defaults/repos.yaml
==> [2021-01-14-13:34:57.281556] Reading config file /mnt/e15/ge28fok/spack/etc/spack/defaults/packages.yaml
==> [2021-01-14-13:34:57.316522] Reading config file /home/ge28fok/.spack/linux/compilers.yaml
==> [2021-01-14-13:34:57.333342] DATABASE LOCK TIMEOUT: 3s
==> [2021-01-14-13:34:57.333403] PACKAGE LOCK TIMEOUT: No timeout
```


### Information on your system

```console
$ ./spack debug report
* **Spack:** 0.16.0-564-f6dd85b
* **Python:** 3.6.8
* **Platform:** linux-rhel7-nehalem
* **Concretizer:** original
```

### Additional information

- [x] I have run `spack debug report` and reported the version of Spack/Python/Platform
- [x] I have searched the issues of this repo and believe this is not a duplicate
- [x] I have run the failing commands in debug mode and reported the output
